definition: to burn/to cook/to stew/to bake/to roast/to heat/to boil (tea, water etc)/fever/to run a temperature/(coll.) to let things go to one's head

sentences.english: Terry Allen burning off bolts on drawbar center casting.

sentences.english: Clay that, when fired, assumes a colour ranging from dull ochre to red.
sentences.chinese: 經燒製後其顏色從淡赭到紅色不等的粗而多孔的黏土。

sentences.english: This beautiful teapot is made of purple clay.

sentences.english: This kind of brick is made of clay, and is mainly used in covering walls and floors.
sentences.chinese: 這種磚是由粘土燒製而成的，主要用於貼牆或鋪地。

sentences.english: The evidence of clay firing at this site are the earliest ever found. The famous Venus figurine was found at this sitte.
sentences.chinese: 在該遺址還發現了粘土燒製的最早證據。

sentences.english: Coconut Shell Charcoal is fired by the shell of coco, its form is lumpish or mealy .

sentences.english: Sponged clean, their glazes shone as brightly as the day they were fired.

sentences.english: Mossbauer parameters are the functions of the firing conditions.
sentences.chinese: 穆斯堡爾譜的參數是燒製條件的函數。

sentences.english: Early Ding wares were fired in separate saggars, with each piece having been incised individually.
sentences.chinese: 早期的定窯是分開燒製的，個別的經過雕刻切割。

sentences.english: In fact, both of the firing methods possess certain advantages as well as disadvantages.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，無窯燒製和陶窯燒製各有其優缺點。

definition: to sinter/to agglomerate ore by burning
to create/to inaugurate/to contrive/to build (a mechanism)
to compound (medicines etc)/to prepare (by mixing ingredients)/to concoct
to cast (pour metal into a mold)
